text.0: on that most wondrous car of yours o indra and agni which looks round on all things living.
text.1: take ye your stand and come to us together and drink libations of the flowing soma.
text.2: as vast as all this world is in its compass deep as it is with its farstretching surface.
text.3: so let this soma be indra and agni made for your drinking till your soul be sated.
text.4: for ye have won a blessed name together yea with one aim ye strove o vṛtraslayers.
text.5: so indraagni seated here together pour in ye mighty ones the mighty soma.
text.6: both stand adorned when fires are duly kindled spreading the sacred grass with lifted ladles.
text.7: drawn by strong soma juice poured forth around us come indraagni and display your favour.
text.8: the brave deeds ye have done indra and agni the forms ye have displayed and mighty exploits.
text.9: the ancient and auspicious bonds of friendshipfor sake of these drink of the flowing soma.
text.10: as first i said when choosing you in battle we must contend with asuras for this soma.
text.11: so came ye unto this my true conviction and drank libations of the flowing soma.
text.12: if in your dwelling or with prince or brahman ye indraagni holy ones rejoice you.
text.13: even from thence ye mighty lords come hither and drink libation of the flowing soma.
text.14: if with the yadus turvaśas ye sojourn with druhyus anus pūrus indraagni.
text.15: even from thence ye mighty lords come hither and drink libations of the flowing soma.
text.16: whether o indraagni ye be dwelling in lowest earth in central or in highest.
text.17: even from thence ye mighty lords come hither and drink libations of the flowing soma.
text.18: whether o indraagni ye be dwelling in highest earth in central or in lowest.
text.19: even from thence ye mighty lords come hither and drink libations of the flowing soma.
text.20: whether ye be in heaven o indraagni on earth on mountains in the herbs or waters.
text.21: even from thence ye mighty lords come hither and drink libations of the flowing soma.
text.22: if when the sun to the midheaven hath mounted ye take delight in food o indraagni.
text.23: even from thence ye mighty lords come hither and drink libations of the flowing soma.
text.24: thus having drunk your fill of our libation win us all kinds of wealth indra and agni.
text.25: this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
